comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; de; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; de; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101207 Thunderbird/3.1.7

Mails from an inbox (I have 4 accounts) are shown twice in the overal inbox.
In the inbox of the account, they appear only once.
This happens almost every time a new mail is received, and only with new mails.

I've made 2 screenshots:
The 1st one shows the inbox with 15 new mails in the inbox, but only a total of 8 in the accounts (it doesn't matter in which accoutn the mail is).
http://temp.funtech.org/Thunderbird-1.png

After selecting all mails and deleting them, only the fake ones stay bahind.
http://temp.funtech.org/Thunderbird-2.png

Even though they have no data in the list, selecting one still shows its full content.
they can't be deleted, but they will disappear when opening the inbox again.

Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: spam1@funtech.org

comments.text:
there is only one error-type:
2011-01-15 23:09:37	gloda.datastore	ERROR	got error in _asyncTrackerListener.handleError(): 19: PRIMARY KEY must be unique

i had it ~10 times in the error-console, and had ~30 fake mails

deleting mails (fake or real) doesn't give additional errors

I have the same issue. I just set up my new PC (Win 7 x64 SP1) and installed the current Thunderbird version:

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; de; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Thunderbird/3.1.9

Then I added my two IMAP accounts and in the grouped inbox new mails are appearing two times.

Unfortunately I cannot reproduce this issue every time. Is there any extra debug input I can deliver?

comments.raw_text: When this happens, does it happen for all new headers added to any inbox, or only initially when the folder is opened, and then new headers that are received after the unified inbox has been open for a while only show up once? If you leave the unified folder by selecting an other folder and then come back to the unified inbox, do you still see the double messages?
comments.author: mozilla@davidbienvenu.org
comments.text: When this happens, does it happen for all new headers added to any inbox, or only initially when the folder is opened, and then new headers that are received after the unified inbox has been open for a while only show up once? If you leave the unified folder by selecting an other folder and then come back to the unified inbox, do you still see the double messages?
comments.creator: mozilla@davidbienvenu.org
stefan.kraemer@net-zone.de
comments.text: It does only happen the first time I'm entering the unified inbox. There for all new headlines except the newest one. When I change folders once or do some operation (e.g. only show unread mails) everything is back to normal.
comments.author: stefan.kraemer@net-zone.de
comments.raw_text: It does only happen the first time I'm entering the unified inbox. There for all new headlines except the newest one. When I change folders once or do some operation (e.g. only show unread mails) everything is back to normal.

comments.author: mozilla@davidbienvenu.org
comments.raw_text: that implies that we're getting a search hit on the new messages, as well as getting notified of new headers, so we add them twice. If you right click on the unified inbox and bring up properties, is the box that says to search online checked or not? If it's checked, you might try unchecking it and seeing if you still have the issue.
comments.creator: mozilla@davidbienvenu.org
comments.text: that implies that we're getting a search hit on the new messages, as well as getting notified of new headers, so we add them twice. If you right click on the unified inbox and bring up properties, is the box that says to search online checked or not? If it's checked, you might try unchecking it and seeing if you still have the issue.
the log shows that the search is being done online, because we're getting search hits.
comments.creator: mozilla@davidbienvenu.org
comments.raw_text: the log shows that the search is being done online, because we're getting search hits.
comments.author: mozilla@davidbienvenu.org

comments.raw_text: Thank's for the tip. I unchecked the online search box and will see if I have the issue again
comments.author: stefan.kraemer@net-zone.de
comments.text: Thank's for the tip. I unchecked the online search box and will see if I have the issue again
comments.creator: stefan.kraemer@net-zone.de

comments.author: spam1@funtech.org

comments.text:
ok, the problem is back.
TB is 7.0.1 in german

there is only one warning in the error-console:
Warnung: getAttributeNodeNS() sollte nicht mehr verwendet werden. Verwenden Sie stattdessen getAttributeNS().
Quelldatei: chrome://messenger/content/messenger.xul
Zeile: 0

it says that getAttributeNS() should be used instead of getAttributeNodeNS()
